skillTree.localised_description: Wulcan may not be the fastest among his peers, his teeth appear uncannily sharp and his eyes have a remarkably yellow glow.
Banners and equipment of Middenland you say? Among the secessionists cargo? Surely this all one big misunderstanding.. Or is it. Whatever it is, not all provinces are happy with the rebellion.
It is rumoured Fort Helmgart has never fallen to assault as long as Hans Frankenwurter lingered behind it's tall walls. Others discard this myth, or attribute this fact to times of peace.
Men, to the walls! These pretenders will never breach the mighty walls of Helmgart. These towers can withstand men, beast, elf and undead a like.
Many fear the prospect of an enemy siege, for Hans however - It is like Festtag.

effects.description:
Defensive supplies: +350 per turn when under siege
	(local region)

Reload time reduction: +10% when under siege
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: One could easily forget the importance of good equipment, Sigmar knows we won't. Too bad Karl's boys left some lying around. Too bad for them, atleast.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Frankenwurter's Company
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +10 for Frankenwurter's Company
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Do you call that wielding a Halberd? You could not even stop an infant squig! We will never beat that imposter Karl Franz with just this rabble alone. To Ubersreik! We need more men.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for Frankenwurter's Company
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Frankenwurter's Company
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +12 for Frankenwurter's Company
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Why govern towns and cities if you can hide behind the tall walls of forts? Who needs a bathhouse if you have a barracks?

effects.description:
Construction cost -20% for Empire Forts
	(all provinces)

Construction cost -30% for Empire Forts
	(all provinces)

Construction cost -40% for Empire Forts
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Hans has seen many of beasts, knights and greenskins come from the other side of the mountain pass. Few have passed, more did not.
We've made it this far, rally, men! They will call me emperor soon enough.. SUMMON THE.. Uh.. Lords?!

The former Margrave of Helmgart, Reinhardt von Mackensen, was famously known for his markmanship with a rifle. His regiment, the Mackensen's Marauders still guard the tall walls of this fort. They not only pass on the name, so to the deadly precision with a handgun.

effects.description:
Missile Damage: +10% for Mackensen's Marauders
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

factionEffects.localised_description: Fort-Commander Frankenwurter leads a rebellion against the coronated Karl Franz

items.colour_text: Bejeweled with gems found deep within the Grey Mountains, this Halberd is passed on from Lord-Commander to Lord-Commander. Upon accepting the title to rule Helmgart, Hans Frankenwurter ordered the Halberd to be engraved with the skull of a young Bretonnian noble from Montfort, who had ambition to expand his hamlet. Unfortunate for the noble he was quick to learn steeds don't climb walls. A lesson he paid for with his life.

In order to stand any chance in political intrigue driven nation known as the Empire, one needs friends in high places. The Western-Provinces, especially Middenland and Marienburg, seem more susceptible to the idea of a change in power, but one does not easily gain audience with the Directorate of Marienburg. Besides being a sturdy Fortresss, Helmgart is also a trade hub for the Gery Mountains. A frequent patron is Reindert van Haagen, a member of one of the ten greatest Merchant Houses of Marienburg. In truth, the Van Haagen family has many debts. Perhaps this grants an opportunity to enlist Reindert and use his family name to gain a foothold in Marienburg.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Lord Frankenwurter, you have the blessing of the wolf for your honorable cause. But know this: If you strike a king - kill a king.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -75% while garrisoned in Fort Helmgart
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 while garrisoned in Fort Helmgart
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for towers during siege battles
	(Lord's army)
